Smith said.`` Particularly party activists don't see a candidate who is either well enough known, or ideologically or intellectually consistent enough for them, so they try to recruit people who fit the bill.

Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam had been chastened, the George H. W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H. W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H. W. Bush at a symposium last week to discuss the war

mummies were seriously damaged by an out-of-control mob at the Egyptian Museum in Cairo yesterday before civilian volunteers saved the vaunted treasure trove of ancient artifacts from greater damage by forming a human chain around the building. I felt deeply sorry today when I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that someone had tried to raid the museum by force last night, said Zahi Hawass , Egypt's top archeologist and star of The History Channel show`` Chasing Mummies.'' I'm not committed to Barack Obama . I'm not committed to a Republican candidate, Colin Powell told CNN Chief Political Correspondent Candy Crowley .`` I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates and finally see who the two candidates are who are going for this position.''``
